intro: Patagonula, commonly known as the Patagonian daisy, is a flowering plant native to the southern regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other similar plants. The plant features showy yellow flowers surrounded by white ray florets, and it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. Patagonula is adapted to withstand harsh climates with its deep root system and drought-resistant characteristics. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
